Message.Issue:
'BxDataCertificateStatusCheck.BxDataCertificateStatusCheck()' contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences:
BxDataCertificateStatusCheck..ctor() BxData.createBxData():Void

BxDataChallengeResponse..ctor() BxData.createBxData():Void

Implement IDisposable on 'ItemBLL' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ItemTableAdapter'. If 'ItemBLL' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type 'RABack'.
Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type 'RABack.ItemDataTable'.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'Utility.pronadjiKontrole(string)' could contain the following variables 'page'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'Utility.pronadjiKontrolePoTipu(string, string)' could contain the following variables 'page', 'controltype'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Implement ISerializable correctly
Rule.Description: If a type is assignable to ISerializable, it should implement GetObjectData. For unsealed types, the GetObjectData method should be callable and overridable by derived types.
Rule.Resolution: Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type {0}.

Rule.Name: Rethrow to preserve stack details
Rule.Description: Use the IL rethrow instruction to preserve original stack details when re-raising a caught exception.
Rule.Resolution: {0} rethrows a caught exception and specifies it explicitly as an argument. Use 'throw' without an argument instead, in order to preserve the stack location where the exception was initially raised.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
